intro: Rubus cyri, commonly known as the common blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring thorny stems and alternate, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces aggregate fruits, known as berries, which are typically dark purple to black in color when ripe. These berries are rich in antioxidants and are often used in culinary applications. Rubus cyri is native to various regions of Europe, Asia, and North America, and it thrives in temperate climates.
